results.title: Émile Zola's “J'accuse” published
results.description: On this day in 1898, French author Émile Zola published an open letter in the newspaper L'Aurore denouncing the French general staff for its role in the 1894 treason conviction of Jewish French army officer Alfred Dreyfus

results.title: Trump Impeached Twice Over Capitol Riot
results.description: Donald Trump became the first U.S. president to be impeached twice, after the House of Representatives approved an article of impeachment that accused him of "incitement of insurrection" for allegedly encouraging his supporters to storm the Capitol in an effort to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, in which Trump was defeated by Joe Biden

results.title: 2012 Costa Concordia disaster off Giglio Island
results.description: The Costa Concordia, a cruise ship carrying some 4,200 people, ran aground and capsized off Giglio Island, Italy; 32 passengers were killed. Learn about seven of the world's deadliest shipwrecks Tullio M. Puglia/Getty Images

results.title: Ecuador President Visits Peru After 150 Years
results.description: President Abdalá Bucaram Ortíz of Ecuador visited President Alberto Fujimori of Peru, marking the first official visit to Peru by an Ecuadoran president in 150 years

results.title: Johnny Cash Records "Johnny Cash at Folsom Prison" Album
results.description: In 1968, American singer-songwriter Johnny Cash recorded his acclaimed album "Johnny Cash at Folsom Prison" in front of an audience of around 2,000 inmates at California's Folsom Prison.

results.title: Henry Ford Patents Plastic Car Construction
results.description: American industrialist Henry Ford patented plastic automobile construction

results.title: Birth of Russian-American Singer Sophie Tucker
results.description: Russian-born American singer Sophie Tucker, known as "the Last of the Red-Hot Mamas," was born in 1884.

results.title: Birth of Renowned Author Horatio Alger
results.description: Horatio Alger, one of the most popular American authors in the last 30 years of the 19th century and perhaps the most socially influential American writer of his generation, was born.How much do you know about famous authors?

results.title: Birth of Salmon P. Chase
results.description: Salmon P. Chase, who served as secretary of the Treasury (1861–64) in Abraham Lincoln's wartime cabinet and later became the sixth chief justice of the United States Supreme Court (1864–73), was born in 1808.
